title: Qualitative set crime rates - conclusions of study

content.description:
Researchers randomly selected 300 adults whom they interviewed about their perception of crime rates from 2002 to 2016. These perceived crime rates were then compared to actual crime rates, and the results of this comparison over that period are depicted in the graph.

Changes in Actual Crime Versus Perceived Crime

All values are approximate.
The following 2 lines are shown:
Real crime
Perceived crime
The Real crime line:
Begins at 2002: negative 6.5%
Falls to 2004: negative 10.8%
Rises to 2008: negative 5%
Remains level to 2010: negative 5%
Rises to 2012: negative 0.1%
Falls to 2014: negative 8.3%
Rises to 2016: negative 2.3%
The Perceived crime line:
Begins at 2002: negative 0.7%
Rises to 2004: 0%
Rises to 2006: 1.9%
Falls to 2008: 1%
Rises to 2010: 2.1%
Falls to 2012: negative 2.8%
Rises to 2014: negative 0.7%
Rises to 2016: 4%
content.question: Which of the following conclusions is correct based on the overall results of this study?

choices.label: Participants expected the actual crime rate to remain relatively stable over the length of the study.
Participants mostly perceived the crime rate to be higher than it was.
Participantsâ€™ predictions accurately tracked the actual crime rate.
Participants believed that the crime rate decreased slowly over the length of the study.

content.answer: Participants mostly perceived the crime rate to be higher than it was.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
